page.title: 10ST. HELENS CHURCH
page.content: St. Helens Church was origionally built by the{Saxons in 812,}then was rebuilt by the{Normans in 1087.}We can tell this as a Crib was found with Coffins in it but unfortunately it was filled in with cement because of subsidence. The outside Tower was built in 1789 but the inside was built in 1329. The {font}inside the Church is made of {solid oak}and there are only two of that kind in the world. One is in London and the other is St, Helens Church. Everything in the Church is made of solid oak except for the Church doors which are made of elm. There are quite a few stained glass windows but they are all modern ones as the old ones were ruined. Most of the history records of Thurnscoe were ruined in the{Fire of York}and the Cathedral in{1843.
